citations.narrative:
On 1/23/2023 a male capybara jumped into an empty pool. It was observed by keepers to have some scrapes and a full
veterinary exam on 1/25/23 found abrasions but no serious injuries due to the incident. Review of the incident during
inspection found that there is a single door between the primary winter holding and the outdoor holding with a drained
pool. While some equipment was being moved out of the winter holding area by employees, the capybara darted out of
the door into the outdoor enclosure area and then jumped into the empty pool. The construction of the enclosure with a
single door between two holding areas did not safely contain the capybara from getting to the outdoor empty pool and
getting injured. Ensure that the enclosure is maintained in a manner that protects the capybaras from injury and contains
them away from pool when it is empty.
**Note: The capybaras are not being housed in the affected enclosure at this time.
***Correction: Ensure to put in place corrections to prevent possible capybara access to the outdoor empty pool prior to
placing capybaras into the affected enclosure area.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
On 1/23/2023 a male capybara jumped into an empty pool.  It was observed by keepers to have some scrapes and a full 
veterinary exam on 1/25/23 found abrasions but no serious injuries due to the incident.  Review of the incident during 
inspection found that there is a single door between the primary winter holding and the outdoor holding with a drained 
pool.  While some equipment was being moved out of the winter holding area by employees, the capybara darted out of 
the door into the outdoor enclosure area and then jumped into the empty pool. The construction of the enclosure with a 
single door between two holding areas did not safely contain the capybara from getting to the outdoor empty pool and 
getting injured.  Ensure that the enclosure is maintained in a manner that protects the capybaras from injury and contains 
them away from pool when it is empty.  
 
**Note: The capybaras are not being housed in the affected enclosure at this time.  
***Correction: Ensure to put in place corrections to prevent possible capybara access to the outdoor empty pool prior to 
placing capybaras into the affected enclosure area. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

End Section
